etymology.description: 齊(齊) (qí, 'together') originally depicted rows of identical teeth in an upper jaw -> later evolved to include 'equal' and 'uniform' meanings
etymology.interpretation: The character 齊(齐) (qí) represents the idea of uniformity and evenness through its depiction of orderly rows of teeth, which visually suggest alignment and harmony.
etymology.simplification: 齊(齊) was simplified to 齐(齊) by streamlining the upper portion to a single uniform shape, maintaining the concept of 'together' and 'even.'

examples.chinese: 大家齐心协力(大家齊心協力)，完成任务(完成任務)。
examples.pinyin: Dàjiā qí xīn xiélì, wánchéng rènwù。
examples.english: Everyone works together to accomplish the task.

examples.chinese: 台上的演员(台上的演員)，站得齐(站得齊)。
examples.pinyin: Tái shàng de yǎnyuán, zhàn dé qí。
examples.english: The actors on stage stand evenly.

examples.chinese: 他的衣服整齐划一(他的衣服整齊劃一)。
examples.english: His clothes are neat and uniform.
